senses.de: A set way of doing something
senses.ex: He followed the procedure for applying to a university.

Tips.title: Sequence Importance
Tips.description: Refers to steps in a specific order; missing or changing order may cause problems.
Tips.example: There's a set procedure for evacuating the building during a fire.

Tips.title: Not Always Written
Tips.description: Procedures can be official rules or just commonly accepted ways to do things.
Tips.example: There's an unwritten procedure for who get to use the gym first.

senses.de: An action that is part of a legal or official process
senses.ex: He was not familiar with the court procedure.

Tips.title: Legally Binding
Tips.description: Legal procedures must be followed to avoid invalidating the process.
Tips.example: The procedure for filing a lawsuit is complex and strict.

Tips.title: Impacts Rights
Tips.description: Understanding legal procedure is critical as it can affect someone's rights.
Tips.example: He lost the case because he misunderstood the procedure for submitting evidence.

senses.de: An action done to achieve a specific medical goal
senses.ex: The doctor performed the procedure to remove his appendix.

Tips.title: Specialized Skills
Tips.description: Medical procedures often require specific training and qualifications to perform.
Tips.example: She trained for years to master the procedure for heart surgery.

Tips.title: Patient Consent
Tips.description: Patients typically must give informed consent before a medical procedure.
Tips.example: Before the procedure, the patient was asked to sign the consent form.

senses.de: A sequence of actions that a computer performs
senses.ex: In programming, a function is a type of procedure.

Tips.title: Repeatability
Tips.description: In computing, procedures are designed to be repeatable and produce consistent results.
Tips.example: The sorting procedure can be run multiple times without errors.

Tips.title: Code Organization
Tips.description: Coding procedures help organize and manage complex programs by breaking them into smaller parts.
Tips.example: Good procedure names make a program easier to understand and maintain.

Approach.wordDefinition:
Approach refers to a general way of doing things or tackling a problem.

It's a broad concept that involves different techniques, strategies, or methods. An approach can be applicable in any situation where a particular goal needs to be achieved.

Procedures are more specific and detailed than approaches and are often used in situations where there are established rules or protocols that need to be followed.

To illustrate, suppose you want to improve your grades in school. You can take a 'learning approach' by experimenting with different study methods until you find what works best for you.

Method.wordDefinition:
Method refers to a specific approach or way of doing something.

For example, a cooking method refers to a set of steps or instructions to follow in order to prepare a particular dish.

Overall, while method is more focused on the approach or way of doing something, procedure is more concerned with the specific steps needed to achieve a particular goal or outcome.

Operation.wordDefinition:
Operation refers to a surgical procedure where doctors use instruments and make incisions in the body to treat an illness or injury.

It can be applied to a wide range of activities, from cooking a meal to following a set of rules in a game. Procedures may or may not involve a physical operation.

To summarize, an operation is a type of medical procedure that involves surgery, while a procedure is a set of steps that can be applied to various activities.

Practice.wordDefinition:
Practice refers to repeatedly doing the same thing or a type of activity to become proficient at it. It's applicable in various fields, like music, sports, or even studying for a test.

In simpler terms, practice is the act of doing something over and over again to get better at it, while procedure is a set of guidelines that must be followed to achieve a desired outcome.

Process.wordDefinition:
Process, on the other hand, generally refers to a larger system or set of actions that are involved in achieving a larger goal.

For example, a business might have a sales process that includes multiple steps, including lead generation, lead nurturing, and closing the sale.

Both words are applicable in a variety of contexts, but procedures tend to be more specific and precise, while processes tend to be more high-level and abstract.

Protocol.wordDefinition:
A protocol is a set of rules, guidelines, or standards that must be followed. It is a specific set of rules that governs how things are done in a certain situation.

For example, a protocol for a medical trial might include specific guidelines for how patients are selected, what treatments are given, and how data is collected and analyzed.

A procedure is a set of steps to follow to complete a task, while a protocol is a set of rules or guidelines to follow for a specific situation.

Procedures are applicable in a wide variety of situations, from making a cake to conducting a scientific experiment, while protocols are more commonly used in specific industries such as medicine or technology.

System.wordDefinition:
A procedure is a specific set of steps that are followed in order to accomplish a task or reach a specific goal. It is more detailed and specific than a system.

A system is a broader concept that refers to a group of procedures or processes that work together to achieve a larger goal.

Systems tend to be more complex and involve several different procedures working in tandem to achieve a specific outcome.

For example, a restaurant might have a system in place for taking orders, preparing food, serving customers, and handling payments.

In summary, procedures are more specific and detailed steps that are used to achieve a smaller task or goal, while a system is a broader concept that refers to a group of procedures or processes used to achieve a larger goal.

Technique.wordDefinition:
Technique refers to a broad set of skills or methods used to achieve a particular goal or outcome. Techniques may vary depending on the situation and the individual using them, and may involve creativity and experimentation.

Techniques can be used in a variety of settings, from artistic techniques used in painting or music, to athletic techniques used in sports, to cooking techniques used in the kitchen.

A procedure is a specific set of steps that need to be followed to achieve a desired outcome, while a technique is a broad set of skills or methods that can be used to achieve a particular goal or outcome, and may vary depending on the situation and individual using them.

videos.Text: There's a push to make researchers raw data, experimental procedures, and analytical techniques more openly available in order to ease replication efforts. The peer review process can also be strengthened to more efficiently weed out weak papers prior to publication. And we could temper the pressure to find big results

videos.Text: Scientists are currently monitoring the world's active volcanoes, and procedures for predicting eruptions, conducting evacuations and diverting lava flows have improved over the years. But the massive scale and global reach of a supervolcano means that for many people there would be nowhere to run.

quotes.Text: Boldface' is a pilot term, a magic word to describe the procedures that could, in a crisis, save your life. We say that 'boldface is written in blood' because often it's created in response to an accident investigation. It highlights the series of steps that should have been taken to avoid a fatal crash, but weren't.
quotes.Title: Canadian Astronaut
quotes.Name: Chris Hadfield

quotes.Text: I have had it with people who are threatening me and my kids and my family over simply commenting on the law and criminal procedure, and respecting juries. Because they do work hard. They work way harder than I do; and they work way harder than the rest of those people making those peanut gallery comments.
quotes.Title: Canadian Journalist
quotes.Name: Ashleigh Banfield

quotes.Text: Once you have a computer that can do a few things - strictly speaking, one that has a certain 'sufficient set' of basic procedures - it can do basically anything any other computer can do. This, loosely, is the basis of the great principle of 'Universality'.
quotes.Title: American Physicist
quotes.Name: Richard P. Feynman

quotes.Text: I've decided to listen to my doctors and get the procedure I need on my knee. USA Basketball said I had to do what was best for me. They want me to be obviously as healthy as possible so I can continue to play this game at a high level.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Dwyane Wade

quotes.Text: The principal factors which influenced my life are 1) nonviolent tactics; 2) constitutional means; 3) democratic procedures; 4) respect for human personality; 5) a belief that all people are one.
quotes.Title: American Leader
quotes.Name: Bayard Rustin

quotes.Text: I unfortunately had a lot of medical procedures throughout my life, so I decided to paint all of my surgeries as a way to heal and as a way to grow.

quotes.Name: Paz de la Huerta

quotes.Text: There is no shame in wanting to age naturally or wanting to 'age gracefully' with a little help from products or procedures.

quotes.Text: London is one of the most civilised places in the world for the procedure of making architecture and urban design.

quotes.Text: Contrary to popular opinion, the hustle is not a new dance step - it is an old business procedure.

quotes.Text: I can't think of a more life-changing procedure for a young woman than an abortion.
quotes.Title: Canadian Businessman
quotes.Name: Doug Ford
